ipxact:component.ipxact:name: IOB-ETH-IOB

ipxact:busInterface.ipxact:name: axi_m
ipxact:busInterface.ipxact:description: AXI manager interface for external memory

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: moder
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: Mode Register

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: int_source
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: Interrupt Source Register

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: int_mask
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: Interrupt Mask Register

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: ipgt
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: Back to Back Inter Packet Gap Register

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: ipgr1
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: Non Back to Back Inter Packet Gap Register 1

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: ipgr2
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: Non Back to Back Inter Packet Gap Register 2

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: packetlen
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: Packet Length (minimum and maximum) Register

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: collconf
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: Collision and Retry Configuration

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: tx_bd_num
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: Transmit Buffer Descriptor Number

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: ctrlmoder
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: Control Module Mode Register

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: miimoder
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: MII Mode Register

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: miicommand
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: MII Command Register

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: miiaddress
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: MII Address Register. Contains the PHY address and the register within the PHY address

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: miitx_data
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: MII Transmit Data. The data to be transmitted to the PHY

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: miirx_data
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: MII Receive Data. The data received from the PHY

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: miistatus
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: MII Status Register

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: mac_addr0
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: MAC Individual Address0. The LSB four bytes of the individual address are written to this register

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: mac_addr1
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: MAC Individual Address1. The MSB two bytes of the individual address are written to this register

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: eth_hash0_adr
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: HASH0 Register

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: eth_hash1_adr
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: HASH1 Register

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: eth_txctrl
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: Transmit Control Register

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: tx_bd_cnt
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: Buffer descriptor number of current TX frame

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: rx_bd_cnt
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: Buffer descriptor number of current RX frame

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: tx_word_cnt
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: Word number of current TX frame

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: rx_word_cnt
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: Word number of current RX frame

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: rx_nbytes
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: Size of received frame in bytes. Will be zero if no frame has been received. Will reset to zero when cpu completes reading the frame.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: frame_word
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: Frame word to transfer to/from buffer

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: phy_rst_val
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: Current PHY reset signal value

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: bd
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: Buffer descriptors

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: version
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: Product version. This 16-bit register uses nibbles to represent decimal numbers using their binary values. The two most significant nibbles represent the integral part of the version, and the two least significant nibbles represent the decimal part. For example V12.34 is represented by 0x1234.

ipxact:port.ipxact:name: axi_araddr_o
ipxact:port.ipxact:description: AXI address read channel byte address.

ipxact:port.ipxact:name: axi_arlen_o
ipxact:port.ipxact:description: AXI address read channel burst length.

ipxact:port.ipxact:name: axi_arsize_o
ipxact:port.ipxact:description: AXI address read channel burst size.

ipxact:port.ipxact:name: axi_arburst_o
ipxact:port.ipxact:description: AXI address read channel burst type.

ipxact:port.ipxact:name: axi_arlock_o
ipxact:port.ipxact:description: AXI address read channel lock type.

ipxact:port.ipxact:name: axi_arcache_o
ipxact:port.ipxact:description: AXI address read channel memory type.

ipxact:port.ipxact:name: axi_arqos_o
ipxact:port.ipxact:description: AXI address read channel quality of service.

ipxact:port.ipxact:name: axi_awaddr_o
ipxact:port.ipxact:description: AXI address write channel byte address.

ipxact:port.ipxact:name: axi_awlen_o
ipxact:port.ipxact:description: AXI address write channel burst length.

ipxact:port.ipxact:name: axi_awsize_o
ipxact:port.ipxact:description: AXI address write channel burst size.

ipxact:port.ipxact:name: axi_awburst_o
ipxact:port.ipxact:description: AXI address write channel burst type.

ipxact:port.ipxact:name: axi_awlock_o
ipxact:port.ipxact:description: AXI address write channel lock type.

ipxact:port.ipxact:name: axi_awcache_o
ipxact:port.ipxact:description: AXI address write channel memory type.

ipxact:port.ipxact:name: axi_awqos_o
ipxact:port.ipxact:description: AXI address write channel quality of service.

ipxact:port.ipxact:name: axi_wlast_o
ipxact:port.ipxact:description: AXI Write channel last word flag.

ipxact:port.ipxact:name: phy_rstn_o
ipxact:port.ipxact:description: Reset signal for PHY. Duration configurable via PHY_RST_CNT parameter.

ipxact:port.ipxact:name: mii_tx_clk_i
ipxact:port.ipxact:description: Transmit Nibble or Symbol Clock. The PHY provides the MTxClk signal. It operates at a frequency of 25 MHz (100 Mbps) or 2.5 MHz (10 Mbps). The clock is used as a timing reference for the transfer of MTxD[3:0], MtxEn, and MTxErr.

ipxact:port.ipxact:name: mii_txd_o
ipxact:port.ipxact:description: Transmit Data Nibble. Signals are the transmit data nibbles. They are synchronized to the rising edge of MTxClk. When MTxEn is asserted, PHY accepts the MTxD.

ipxact:port.ipxact:name: mii_tx_en_o
ipxact:port.ipxact:description: Transmit Enable. When asserted, this signal indicates to the PHY that the data MTxD[3:0] is valid and the transmission can start. The transmission starts with the first nibble of the preamble. The signal remains asserted until all nibbles to be transmitted are presented to the PHY. It is deasserted prior to the first MTxClk, following the final nibble of a frame.

ipxact:port.ipxact:name: mii_tx_er_o
ipxact:port.ipxact:description: Transmit Coding Error. When asserted for one MTxClk clock period while MTxEn is also asserted, this signal causes the PHY to transmit one or more symbols that are not part of the valid data or delimiter set somewhere in the frame being transmitted to indicate that there has been a transmit coding error.

ipxact:port.ipxact:name: mii_rx_clk_i
ipxact:port.ipxact:description: Receive Nibble or Symbol Clock. The PHY provides the MRxClk signal. It operates at a frequency of 25 MHz (100 Mbps) or 2.5 MHz (10 Mbps). The clock is used as a timing reference for the reception of MRxD[3:0], MRxDV, and MRxErr.

ipxact:port.ipxact:name: mii_rxd_i
ipxact:port.ipxact:description: Receive Data Nibble. These signals are the receive data nibble. They are synchronized to the rising edge of MRxClk. When MRxDV is asserted, the PHY sends a data nibble to the Rx MAC. For a correctly interpreted frame, seven bytes of a preamble and a completely formed SFD must be passed across the interface.

ipxact:port.ipxact:name: mii_rx_dv_i
ipxact:port.ipxact:description: Receive Data Valid. The PHY asserts this signal to indicate to the Rx MAC that it is presenting the valid nibbles on the MRxD[3:0] signals. The signal is asserted synchronously to the MRxClk. MRxDV is asserted from the first recovered nibble of the frame to the final recovered nibble. It is then deasserted prior to the first MRxClk that follows the final nibble.

ipxact:port.ipxact:name: mii_rx_er_i
ipxact:port.ipxact:description: Receive Error. The PHY asserts this signal to indicate to the Rx MAC that a media error was detected during the transmission of the current frame. MRxErr is synchronous to the MRxClk and is asserted for one or more MRxClk clock periods and then deasserted.

ipxact:port.ipxact:name: mii_crs_i
ipxact:port.ipxact:description: Carrier Sense. The PHY asynchronously asserts the carrier sense MCrS signal after the medium is detected in a non-idle state. When deasserted, this signal indicates that the media is in an idle state (and the transmission can start).

ipxact:port.ipxact:name: mii_col_i
ipxact:port.ipxact:description: Collision Detected. The PHY asynchronously asserts the collision signal MColl after the collision has been detected on the media. When deasserted, no collision is detected on the media.

ipxact:port.ipxact:name: mii_mdio_io
ipxact:port.ipxact:description: Management Data Input/Output. Bi-directional serial data channel for PHY/STA communication.

ipxact:port.ipxact:name: mii_mdc_o
ipxact:port.ipxact:description: Management Data Clock. This is a clock for the MDIO serial data channel.

ipxact:component.ipxact:description: IObundle's ethernet core. Driver-compatible with the [ethmac](https://opencores.org/projects/ethmac) core, containing a similar Control/Status Register interface.

ipxact:parameter.ipxact:name: PHY_RST_CNT
ipxact:parameter.ipxact:description: PHY reset counter value. Sets the duration of the PHY reset signal. Suggest smaller value during simulation, like 20'h00100.

ipxact:parameter.ipxact:name: VERSION
ipxact:parameter.ipxact:description: Product version. This 16-bit macro uses nibbles to represent decimal numbers using their binary values. The two most significant nibbles represent the integral part of the version, and the two least significant nibbles represent the decimal part.
